questions.question_text_1: A pharmaceutical company is testing a new drug. The probability that a patient experiencing a side effect from this drug is 0.10. If the drug is given to 5 patients, what is the probability that more than 1 patient will experience the side effect? (Enter the answer correct to 2 decimal places.)
question_texts: A pharmaceutical company is testing a new drug. The probability that a patient experiencing a side effect from this drug is 0.10. If the drug is given to 5 patients, what is the probability that more than 1 patient will experience the side effect? (Enter the answer correct to 2 decimal places.)

questions.question_text_1: An internet service provider advertises a download speed between 50 Mbps and 100 Mbps for its basic plan, which follows a uniform distribution. Based on the given information, answer the subquestions
question_texts: An internet service provider advertises a download speed between 50 Mbps and 100 Mbps for its basic plan, which follows a uniform distribution. Based on the given information, answer the subquestions

questions.question_text_1: What is the probability that a user on this plan will experience a download speed of exactly 60 Mbps?
question_texts: What is the probability that a user on this plan will experience a download speed of exactly 60 Mbps?

questions.question_text_1: What is the probability that a user on this plan experiences a download speed of at least 80 Mbps given that user has experienced download speed of at least 70 Mbps?

questions.question_text_1: The time it takes for a computer system to reboot after a crash follows an exponential distribution with a mean time of 0.5 hours. What is the probability that the system will be back online within 1 hour of the crash?
question_texts: The time it takes for a computer system to reboot after a crash follows an exponential distribution with a mean time of 0.5 hours. What is the probability that the system will be back online within 1 hour of the crash?

questions.question_text_1: The number of network failures in a company follows a Poisson distribution, with an average rate of 1 network failure per week. What is the probability that there will be no network failure in the next 14 days? (Note: 1 week = 7 days) (Enter the answer correct to 2 decimal places.)
question_texts: The number of network failures in a company follows a Poisson distribution, with an average rate of 1 network failure per week. What is the probability that there will be no network failure in the next 14 days? (Note: 1 week = 7 days) (Enter the answer correct to 2 decimal places.)

options.option_text: Brand of smartphones (Realme, Samsung, Vivo etc.) have ordinal scale ofmeasurement.
Bar chart must preserve the order for ordinal data.
Relative frequency is useful to compare two different datasets.
Time (in hours) taken by a student to complete a project is a discrete variable.

questions.question_text_1: A box contains 2 red pens, 3 black pens and 4 blue pens. In how many ways can 3 pens be drawn from the box, if at least one black pen is to be included in the box?
question_texts: A box contains 2 red pens, 3 black pens and 4 blue pens. In how many ways can 3 pens be drawn from the box, if at least one black pen is to be included in the box?
